newsitem.title: USA: Union Pacific to buy Southern Pacific debt.
newsitem.headline: Union Pacific to buy Southern Pacific debt.

text.p: Union Pacific Corp said on Wednesday it will begin a tender offer for any and all of the outstanding $375 million in principal of 9-3/8 percent senior notes due 2005 of Southern Pacific Rail Corp.

The offer, which expires October 2, 1996, will be conditioned upon completion of the merger with Southern Pacific Rail Corp, which is expected to become effective September 11, 1996, Union Pacific said.

Union Pacific said the purchase price for the notes will be set at 1400 EDT, on September 30, 1996. The notes are first callable on August 15, 1998 at a price of 104.167 percent of the principal amount.
Union Pacific said the purchase price for the notes tendered will be based upon the first call date applicable to the notes and the 9-1/4 percent U.S. Treasury Note due August 15, 1998.
